sections.1_story_intuition: Inventions and discoveries have shaped human progress and are a frequent topic in competitive exams. This section covers important inventions, their inventors, key scientific discoveries, and their impact on daily life. Knowing these facts helps candidates answer static GK questions quickly and accurately.
2_key_definitions: Invention: Creation of a new device, process, or method.
Discovery: Finding something that already exists in nature.
Inventor: Person who creates an invention.
Scientist: Person who studies or practices science.
Patent: Legal right granted for an invention.
Innovation: Improvement or new idea based on existing knowledge.
Theory: Explanation based on facts and reasoning.
Experiment: Scientific test to discover or prove something.
Breakthrough: Major advance in knowledge or technology.
Nobel Prize: Prestigious award for scientific achievement.
3_key_facts_data_points: Telephone invented by Alexander Graham Bell.
Light bulb invented by Thomas Edison.
Television invented by John Logie Baird.
Steam engine invented by James Watt.
Periodic table created by Dmitri Mendeleev.
Internet developed by Vint Cerf and Bob Kahn.
DNA structure discovered by Watson and Crick.
Printing press invented by Johannes Gutenberg.
5_exam_capsules: Who invented the telephone? Alexander Graham Bell.
Who invented the light bulb? Thomas Edison.
Who invented the airplane? Wright brothers.
Who invented the computer? Charles Babbage.
Who created the periodic table? Mendeleev.
Who invented the television? John Logie Baird.
Who developed the internet? Vint Cerf & Bob Kahn.
Who discovered DNA structure? Watson & Crick.
7_traps_confusing_points: Confusing inventors of telephone and radio.
Mixing up Edison and Tesla's inventions.
Mixing up discovery of electron and proton.
Assuming all inventors won Nobel Prize.

8_case_study_context.title: Penicillin: The First Antibiotic
8_case_study_context.explanation: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928, revolutionizing medicine by introducing the first antibiotic. This discovery has saved millions of lives and is a landmark in medical history.
